snippet: An annual report says that in 2013 there were 40 instances in which officers shot at suspects, down from 45 the previous year and from an 11-year high of 61 in 2003.
abstract: Annual New York City Police Department report shows that in 2013 there were only 40 shootings by police officers, either unintentional or in course of confrontations with suspects, lowest level in decade.
lead_paragraph: An annual report says that in 2013 there were 40 instances in which officers shot at suspects, down from 45 the previous year and from an 11-year high of 61 in 2003.

headline.main: Shootings by New York City Police Fell in 2013
headline.print_headline: Shootings by the Police Fell in 2013
